author: victorcorcino
title: The Catalyst School Fund9 Operation
description: Proposers, Advisors, Voters and other Catalyst members still struggle to understand how Catalyst works and how to play their roles.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is a good idea. I believe Catalyst School, if successful, will solve the problem posed by the Challenge of converting ADA holders into active Catalyst members; improving the quality of the courses. proposer, CA. Besides that, I think Catalyst School is a place to gather documents and videos related to Catalyst and disseminate and retrain new members as well as current Catalyst members who are lacking in experience and knowledge. In terms of ideas, I find the idea good and meaningful.
Write a clear, easy-to-understand proposal on how the project will contribute to the building and development of Catalyst, Cardano.
I realize that if this proposal is successful, there could be more valuable to Catalyst in the future.
One thing I don't see very clearly in this Impact section is how to address the risk that the project is facing. It is the risk of the number of people attending the courses or seminars. I see you mentioned the solution is to increase marketing, improve outreach strategies to attract more participants. I think if you describe the marketing plan more specifically, how to attract participants, the proposal will be more solid, and clear.
f6_assessments.q1:
First, about the team members implementing the proposal, according to the information stated in the proposal, I understand your team has enough personnel with good experience and skills, suitable to carry out this project. However, I can't check the accuracy of the information about the team members you provided, because I can't find any links or attachments related to the members' experiences. You should attach qualifications, CV, or Linkedin link of members.
Regarding the budget, you list quite detailed the necessary costs for implementation. And it's great that you include an explanation of why the proposed budget is higher this time than before. This increases budget coherence. I wonder why you charge the execution cost according to the unit price of 50USD/hour and not according to the work item results.?! And in the budget section you mentioned Marketing costs but only costs for weekly Twitter, Telegram, Discord announcements, visual identity management costs... Is this a marketing strategy? You mentioned in the risk resolution section, is that right? Is posting weekly announcements an effective way to attract people to join your courses? I think you should have a marketing strategy and then make marketing costs based on that will be more appropriate.
f6_assessments.q2:
About the roadmap, I see you have written in the "Feasibility" section. You will implement this project in 6 weeks. However, I have not seen clear indicators to evaluate the effectiveness of each stage in the project. the route you stated.
In the "AUDITABILITY" section, you have a way to measure the progress and development of the project, but there are no specific numbers for each part. For example, how many conference videos will be uploaded to the Youtube channel? How much new content will be posted on the site? How many members will register for 1:1 support after 6 weeks? The community can check your progress through your website and youtube channel, but it is not your KPIs to see if you are performing effectively and on schedule.
Similarly, in the success measurement section, it will be much more convincing if you state how many workshop participants are expected to reach? how many 1:1 support courses are provided? Youtube video views? What is the expected number of website visits? What is the expected number of registrations on the website?.... Estimating the exact number can be a bit difficult, but it will help the project clearly define its goals and community as well as Catalyst's assessment. evaluate the effectiveness of the project.
I hope Catalyst School will be successful in the future.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is certainly in line with the objectives of the challenge. The Catalyst School is already a pretty solid group within our community, known for really being the best place for new people to get involved with the Catalyst process. The principles of this project are perfectly summarized in the excerpt “We onboard new members and help improve their skills along the way, in whatever way they decide to get involved with Catalyst: as a Proponent, Community Advisor, Veteran Community Advisor or without any specific role in the process”. And we know how they do it too, through: “live sessions and workshops, 1-to-1 and group support in many different languages, interactive website and other Catalyst-related workshops”. During the description of the impact, the proponents position those readers who are not yet familiar with the project very well, explaining the main topics addressed by the School and how it is currently operating, that is, what practical activities are being carried out at the moment. The proponents also put us very well on the need for the School to exist: Catalyst is really a differentiated type of funding that has its own rules. In other words, the problem established here is that a person, without the proper guidance, usually cannot understand what Catalyst is or how to get involved, where to start, how to fit into this process that for those who are not yet used to it. it becomes complex. With that, this project very well meets what is asked in the challenge, as we seek to facilitate the participation of new people in our community, and one of the ways that anyone can participate in the Cardano ecosystem is by being CA or vCA, for example. So, by making it easier for people who don't understand very well to get involved with Catalyst, acting in any of the roles previously listed, it's certainly benefiting the sum of new members. Finally, I conclude that it is of fundamental importance that this proposal be funded, so that the professionals who make this initiative happen can be adequately remunerated and continue this work, so important for the overall growth of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of the proposal is very good. We know exactly what would be done in practice, as the proponents explain what activities would be carried out on a weekly basis. It is positive that it is already an ongoing project, and the professionals involved already have experience with what they do, so they will not start from scratch at this stage. The proponents state that some adaptations in the development of the project will be made, such as the reduction of the number of workshops, I believe that in order to have more people participate in the sessions and that they can be a little longer and full of content. We know exactly which topics would be covered each week, for example: “week 2 - Submission Phase: 1 x Introduction to Catalyst (After City Council and Swarm Session) and 2 x Proposing in Catalyst (After City Council Municipality and the Enxame Session)”. With this, the visualization of the process is very solid, it is totally understandable how this proposal would develop in practice. Analyzing the funding requested, 17,800 dollars are requested, which in my opinion is a very fair value for the amount of service that will be delivered and also for the number of people who will dedicate themselves to the project. The payment of professionals is also explained very clearly, it is 50 dollars an hour for them to perform various services. The amount of hours each one would work on the project is also defined, that is, again it is very easy for us to understand this part of the proposal. They also define how each part of the whole (management, marketing, etc.) would cost in total, allowing us another angle of analysis for the budget. Finally, analyzing the team, I really think that there is a lot of confidence in the team's ability to deliver the expected results. I think this for two reasons: first, this project has been going on for some time, any and all members of our community can participate in the workshops, in the Telegram channel dedicated especially to School and see in practice that the project is really serious and constant in your deliveries. That is, the team is really responsible and has already proven this in service. In addition, the proponents attach a short description of each one of them, so that we can get to know them individually, know what professional areas they work in and some of their previous experiences.
f6_assessments.q2: Firstly, it is very simple for us to audit the school's activities just because we are part of the Telegram group they have. Second, they provide a very specific roadmap on what would be done each week, knowing exactly the activities that must be developed and the small goals to be achieved, so I think it is very possible for us to audit the process. In addition, the proponents state that: “We will provide progress reports to the IOG at the biweekly coordinator meetings and to the challenge team at the monthly meeting”. Not enough, they also suggest various ways in which the community can follow your achievements, whether through their youtube channel, the official website or the contact list they provide. In other words, we are absolutely sure that it is possible to safely monitor the tasks carried out in a progressive manner. Talking about the final results, it is very possible that we also understand what success is, as the proponents state various objectives, such as the “number of workshop participants (maximum and average), the number of 1 to 1 support sessions provided and the number of views on our YouTube videos.” I usually say that it is necessary for proponents to force a qualitative and quantitative analysis of the activities they seek to develop, however, due to the nature of this proposal, in order to analyze the quality of the workshops and all the time of service that this group provides, it is enough that we participate in their activities. So, really the best way to measure success is by the numbers, by the reach that the group owes in relation to how many people became active members of the Cardano community and started to work on Catalyst in a guided way. Finally, I agree that it is a fully auditable proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe this proposal effectively addresses the challenge by providing a smooth transition for ADA holders that attend the Cardano townhall meets to being an involved member of the Catalyst ecosystem.
It also helps newcomers navigate the Cardano Ideascale as a proposer, CA, vCA or just someone that is browsing through.
Personally, I have benefited from The Catalyst School videos immensely. 
The only reason I chose a rating of 4 instead of a 5 is that specific information is hard to dig out from the videos since most of them extend to a length of one hour.
It’d be really helpful to viewers if there were time stamps on the videos and if there can be slight editing to make the viewing experience more crisp.
In addition to that, the website navigation is not user friendly at this point. It’s still a challenge to browse through the contents on https://thecatalyst.school/
f6_assessments.q1:
The Catalyst School team is very experienced and are well known members of the Catalyst community. The team also has a track record of success based on their involvement in previous Catalyst funds, Youtube channel and their website. 
I believe it’s highly likely that this proposal will be implemented.
There are a couple of points that I'd have loved to see more details on. 
Is there a selection process for the 1 on 1 sessions or is it on a first come first serve basis?
What is the marketing plan to attract more ADA holders to the Catalyst School  socials?
Is there a qualitative and quantitative aspect to the feedback received from members benefiting through The Catalyst School?
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes, the audibility of the project is very clear. Number of workshop participants, feedback from 1-on-1 sessions along with YT and website analytics provides a clear picture of the impact created by the Catalyst School team. 
Each step of the roadmap can be tracked through the videos posted and number of feedback forms received from individuals or teams.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets out a very clear problem which is the difficulty of all the members to easily understand the functioning of Catalyst in order to be able to take roles. This fully corresponds to the needs of the challenge, as well as the solution provided. What is appreciable is the details how it works and brings real proof with the videos and their youtube channel. All these explanations make really understandable the positive impact of this proposal as well as its previous successes. This impact is conscious and this effort to be understood are coherent with their approach. As this project is part of a continuity and adapts to the needs of the community, it is able to address future challenges. Its coherence with the challenge is multiple and the didactic aspect to address all of this proposal is in itself a proof of the awareness of this group.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team made up of 10 active members is well identifiable, it seems really solid and to have already proven itself, as well as their skills, their experience, and the fact that they are well integrated members in the community is a plus as confidence index. Links to their profiles could have been given, but the many other proofs like the link of the site, the videos seem to give ample informations. It is possible to easily join their different groups (telegram, discord, youtube, twitter…). The budget itself is very detailed and would seem almost underestimated in view of the considerable investment of the team, which shows the integrity of this approach.
This proposal is really complete, both in terms of the plan, realistic in time and the different tasks to be accomplished. The experience of this team addresses the risks in a conscious way by providing solutions. Personally, unless forgotten on my part, I find nothing to complain about or add to prove the success of its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The many partners, as well as the establishment of this project from several funds within the community are elements that provide considerable indices of confidence. The roadmap is detailed, the KPIs make sense and are closely linked to those of the challenge. Transparency and the effort of the team to guarantee diverse feedback to the community seems to be the object of particular attention in this project. We will be able to follow their progress thanks to their YouTube Channel, their website, asked for 1-to-1 support sessions…
As well as their success index are clearly identifiable both qualitatively and quantitatively.
I encourage you to keep up the momentum and professionalism.

f6_assessments.q0:
Education is important at all stages and understanding how to navigate and assess proposal with constructive feedback is key to growth cardano ecosystem. 
Doing this, the catalyst school have demonstrated that capabilities and is onboarding many people at each funding cycle.  

Improving the existing resources is needed so that newcomers and veterans will continue to find the navigation tools easy to surf the site. In this prospects, the proposal is aligned and have the gross potential to contribute to the onboarding processes.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a clear deliverable framework with a tutorial approach that defines what to do and when to do it. There is the inherent success sniffed through the deliverables and with the well endowed, matured and experienced team the objectives of the proposal will be achieved.

The budget is also detailed only that project management fees is quite high and should be reviewed downwards. Except for this, the solid team will deliver for results, to grow CAs and vCAs so that they  provide high quality assessments.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPI are very much in order and have well informed metrics to evaluate the project. Notwithstanding that the variables are not assigned measurable metrics, it is still less difficult a task to audit. 

It also important to show a sustainability plan to understand whether the proposer would continue to receive funding through the cardano ecosystem support so that the tutorials are done continually.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Proposal raised the problem Proposers, Advisors, voters, and other Catalyst members are still struggling to understand how Catalyst works and how their roles should be fulfilled. The solution the team offers is Catalyst school which will improve the contribution of all its different players and roles. There will be Live Lessons and Workshops .
1-on-1 and group support in various languages.
Interactive website.
Other Catalyst related seminars. Catalyst school has been active since fund 6, and has introduced over 1000 new Catalyst members.
f6_assessments.q1: The group has 10 key members, They are experienced with Catalyst. people who work regularly with Catalyst will probably know them. But I still recommend that they provide evidence, links to prove their own experience to match the requirements of catalyst, and newcomers will easily evaluate the skills and experience of the group. The team also provided a roadmap with milestones. total budget requested to fund the proposal is $17,800 itemized in clear, specific numbers, the requested amount is detailed for each hour of work. I consider it reasonable. The team recognized the risks faced from practice during Fund 7 and began implementing solutions to these risks.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provided a roadmap with clear, verifiable timelines, all workshops posted to the youtube channel, updated content on the website, providing a list of participants. requested 1-1 supported. Measure success by the number of workshop participants, number of 1-to-1 sessions, youtube views, website visits, and website channel subscriptions. and finally as mentioned above this is a follow-up project, it worked on fund 7 and had some results.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although it is now Fund 8 catalyst, it seems to be very new and quite unfamiliar to the majority of the community.
Part of the reason comes from the media:
Media content is a bit academic and difficult to reach for many people.
Currently, the main form of communication is introduced by one person to another in the form of word of mouth and is not really commensurate with the potential of catalyst.
This is why there is a need for materials that are more approachable, user-friendly and with more engaging content.
The proposal of "Catalyst School" is quite appropriate at this stage, in order to promote more countries and more high-quality personnel to cardano for development.
f6_assessments.q1:
The recommended team is mainly experienced CAs and vCAs, in addition they have educators and university lecturers. That shows they have the ability to create content that is accessible to many people.
Working sessions are held weekly and are fully documented and provided to attendees.
Organizing discussions and sharing experiences and knowledge related to catalysts is not too complicated. So I believe this project is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
To report the work progress, they will provide a report to the IOG every 2 weeks, and the report is monthly.
Discussions and training are uploaded to youtube and made public for the community to view, ask questions, and spread content.
Also they have one-on-one tutorials depending on the needs of the community for more detailed instructions.
I think these tools are useful and appreciated.

f6_assessments.q0:
Somehow this proposal is made for this Challenge and fittingly so. Catalyst School from its ideation to its iteration has stayed true to their core values of; (in my opinion) providing learning avenues on "How to be a CA?", "How to be a vCA?", "How to propose?", "How to assess?" etc. In a nutshell this proposal meets directly to ALL the Challenge's key metrics. There is no doubt their continued and expanded presences is needed.

I myself am a product of Catalyst School, including my ever growing social circle that is onboarding themselves onto Catalyst through the roles introduced by Catalyst School which were forwarded by me. The value of Catalyst School I believe is undervalued by the Cardano community. If we where to submit a survey on how we came to be onboard Project Catalyst, I am confident it will show a majority came from Catalyst School/Catalyst School materials.

They mentioned they had low outreach but most likely they did not realize that the community itself has been taking on their educating mantle unknown to the core team. It is only just recently the core team have allocated funds to this group of volunteering trailblazers. Fair compensation that is needed for further participation. A situation that also applies to Catalyst School.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of hardened and experience core members of the initial Cardano community ambers. For those looking to see and know of the history of Cardano's community, look no further, you have all their contacts available to be scrutinized.

These assessment I am providing to the community are assessment methods that I have learned from Catalyst School. A testament to the effectiveness of Catalyst School and all its caveats.

The plan presented is also a continuation of their previous funded plan that they have delivered on. As mentioned in this proposal, there are numerous YouTube video links which are an actualization of their KPI's. I did notice that there is a slight increase in the budget requested which the team has also provided explanations regarding that. The core operations of Catalyst School has always been solid and it is fittingly so that they noticed further need for budgets to expand the quality and the reach of their services.

Through iteration after iteration, I strongly believe Catalyst School will eventually reach an infliction point where it is the go to place to start on Cardano. With that said, I only have gleaming assessments for this team and project.
f6_assessments.q2:
As a multiple funded entity, proposers are obligated to submit a detailed report to IOG and most recently to the newly formulated entity called Challenge team. This entails the Catalyst School team has a proper audit report. If I were to provide one piece of input to the proposers is to refine the website so it becomes a source for the larger community to easily gauge the progress of Catalyst School as an entity. At this very moment only IOG and the Challenge receives detailed report. Perhaps other parts of the community would like to know the reason Catalyst School is continually funded. Which of course is due to them meeting their targeting KPI's. The community should understand, IOG has the power to refrain from further fund distribution if deemed some/all KPI's have not been met.

In conjunction with the team meeting auditing requirements, the larger community can view their work and discussion through Discord and their YouTube channels. Which to this date is continually active and updated. Including all Catalyst School materials can be found there also.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree with the problem and solution as stated in the proposal.  This is an existing on-boarding organization for Project Catalyst.  Noobs struggle to understand Catalyst and the different roles they can play.  The proposed solution, the Catalyst School, provides value by improving the contribution of different Catalyst phases (such as the Insight sharing phase, proposal phase and assessment phase) and roles (Voter, CA/ vCA/ proposer). 

Importantly, the proposal has been operating since Fund6 and is seeking to continually improve 'teaching methods and content'.  I would love to see improvements we can be proud of as an innovation platform.  I am confident this team can do it because, among many things, they are willing to collaborate and form partnerships.

This funding will provide 8 workshop sessions and 30 individual / small group tutoring support sessions in Fund9 according to Phase
f6_assessments.q1:
The leadership and team are experienced Catalyst members.  The team is large enough to accomplish the task and the proposal lists many partnerships with Catalyst groups, such as Gimbalabs and WADA.

I only see two team members with professional digital education credentials.  Perhaps, one area for improvement would be to increase funding and include an educational technologist.

Team roles and responsibilities are specifically stated with individual budgets.

I have no doubts this proposal will be implemented successfully and will meet the challenge criteria.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a clear roadmap with a relevant timeframe according to the phases of Catalyst.   The KPIs are clear and public.  

However, the proposal does not directly measure the impact to Catalyst in terms of improving quality and quantity of contribution.  As a community we should measure not only did the roadmap milestones take place, but did they have the intended effects.  The KPIs measure if teaching took place, but not if the students learned the material.   It would add value to measure the efficacy or effectiveness of the classes themselves.  For example, we should be able to answer the questions: Are proposals written by students improved? Do students understand their roles better? What and how well did the students learn?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses a number of different aspects of the challenge: increased awareness, more meaningful participation, utilisation of tools in Catalyst. The Catalyst school has a proven track record in being able to scale and and reach out globally, this is evidenced through the collaborations  they have effected. The proposal is extremely well presented and should be very simple for the voters to understand. The school has been able to become an trusted  entity that the community can galvanise around and thus a great candidate for funding
f6_assessments.q1: The activities, budget and deliverables are clearly listed and simple to understand. This, alongside their track record provides confidence that this work will be delivered successfully. The only slight hesitation i have in giving this a full 5 star rating is its not possible to work out which (which resources) will play which role). A simple alignment of plan v names resources v budget would have provided the evidence that the proposer had done their due diligence.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones and outcomes of this project are simple to track through the various channels identified. In terms of metrics quantitative tracking (number of youtube views, number of workshop attendees) is great but to take this to the next level the proposer could start to think about qualitative measure to generate an understanding of how well the videos, workshops are being received. This should also help with further improvements and innovations.

f6_assessments.q0:
The main idea of this proposal is regarding the improvement of how members, veteran or new, can contribute to each other knowledge on their functions and roles and why they are important to the consolidation and growth of Catalyst project. I understand that, according to the previous phase and video presented on YouTube, this project has a great impact to the community once the project members are capable of guiding other people through the paths they should course. According to Victor’s talk, it seems to be an open place where everyone can join and participate with their idea, independently of its complexity. 
A point of critic would be regarding the risks the project members foresee. Risk is something that hasn’t happened but there is a chance of happening so, for them, we must create mitigation actions that would dimmish or invalidate the impacts of what the risk could bring into the project. The difficulty of outreach, as they say, is something that already happened during Fund7 and so they acted managing some actions (marketing and outreach strategy). Therefore, this is a problem mapped and not risk. So, I believe and suggest them to brainstorm with other members to create a robust risk matrix with impact and probability axis where they could cover several other risks that could be happening and, therefore, generate a more fluid environment of work.
f6_assessments.q1:
I will split Feasibility analysis in 2 segments: time and cost: 

Time Feasibility seems to be adequate and more carefully built in comparison of previous funds covering gaps that were not mapped before. Reducing the number of workshops is also a good strategy because a better material will be presented, and more value will be created to the public. The roadmap is well designed but, as a critic, I believe that the milestones should be clear somewhere (maybe on project’s website) discussing about the topics that will be presented during each workshop.
Cost Feasibility also seems to be adequate and carefully built. According to the project members experience, they know how long time each role will take to accomplish their tasks and guarantee their deliverables. The explanation of whey this proposal is more expensive than before is also well based and aligned with the Outreach strategy (“We are including more content creation than before”).
f6_assessments.q2:
KPIs are measurable values that demonstrates how effectively a company, or a project is achieving their results and, according to my analysis, there are lack of evaluation tools on this proposal. Usually, KPIs are demonstrated in percentage or parametrized values, and, in this proposal, I can only see that the metrics are on “raw numbers”, therefore it is not possible to say if it is good or if it can be improved (i.e.: if we have 50 new members subscription, it could represent 1% or 100% of a determinate target). 
Gantt diagram could be used in association with PDCA (plan-do-check-act) method that would assist the team project with the project progress, check its advances and act in case of deviations to support the analysis and auditability if the milestones would be achieved.
For the record, three KPIs that could be used for this project’s schedule could be: milestones achievement; lateness percentage; physical advance.  
Out of the 3 pillars, this one has to pass through a few more improvements in comparison with the other two.

f6_assessments.q0:
the catalyst school has been widely used since past funds to receive and onboard new members through a strcutured format, usging townhalls, telegram channel (with nearly 200 participants) and 1 to 1 support.
Cover their operation in F9 is key to keep with this good work they have been developing. I also see the proposal aligned with the challenge, addressing kpis goals as "convert passive ADA holders into active Catalyst members", "increasing awareness of Project Catalyst as the most active open innovation platform" ath the same time they prepare bbeter CAs, VCAs and proposers, for free.
It is also good to see they intend to improve their approach, providing coaching sessions by F9 catalyst stages.
As suggestions, to improve proposal, I'd bring here some numbers related to how many attendees they averagely get in each sessions, how many trainings and 1-to-1 meetings they had, how many proposals were funded with their support and so on.
This would help to assess the impact of the catalyst school so far in a more quantiative manner.
f6_assessments.q1:
There's a clear time-framed plan with enough details on how they intend to operate next fundand what changes will be made. 
Budget breakdown is very detailed with the roles of each person, the activities they will develop and for how many hours. The overall budget is a bit high but it is explained why it is higher than the one requested in previous fund.
Regarding the team, there are 10 people already commited and running the operation, so I gues they are fully capable to keep doing this job. There are good description on team background but linkedin links could be provided though.
f6_assessments.q2:
there material they will provide (as uploaded youtube videos) and the proposed kpis (good ones) should be enough to audit the prooject. 
The only point that I think could be improved here is how they intend to grow from previous fund(s). For that, there could be some percetage target to propose increments in the Number of workshops participants, number of 1-to-1 support sessions provided and so on. 
this would allow to verify how they are improving and growing overtime. 
some kpi related to the feedback they will collect (in forms) could also be explored here.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge of onboarding new catalyst users by providing helpful educational resources. The team has proven to be capable of delivering educational materials, and I have personally used their instructional videos and found them helpful to get onboarded to Catalyst. They have provided a clear roadmap with measurable milestones for success.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers previous work is adequate evidence that they are capable of delivering on this proposal. They have created useful educational resources in the past, and plan to build on that success. They have provided a clear roadmap with measurable and auditable goals, and a clear budget breakdown and explanation of how the funds will be used. The rate of $50/hr seems reasonable for the quality of work provided and value to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditing section of this proposal is well written, and the KPI's for auditing the success of this project have been provided. However, they lack specific target numbers. Without precise target numbers for the KPI's given, it will be difficult for the community to assess if they have delivered on their goals, or if the voters have received what they have paid for. "Being able to onboard a large number of new members into Catalyst." is not clearly defined. It is assumed the number of users will increase, but difficult to know how many of those users are joining because of this funded proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem described in this proposal is closely aligned with the challenge. The proposed solution seems to have a great impact to the community once the project members are capable of guiding people considering their roles, own limitations and individual preferences. Besides that, I felt a lot of assurance because they cited important partnerships and value the importance of having a powered ecosystem. I also could see that the team is trying to not committee same mistakes as previous projects, learning with experiences and taking previous actions to avoid the low attendance. Despite that, as the attendance is the key component of this project execution and impact assurance, I think they could explore more a risk mapping to create previously some scenarios aiming dimmish or the impacts of an unexpected event.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeframe and budget program are clearly laid out and seems very assertive considering the context that the team are working in and previous experiences. Establishing a budget to pay for each role and workload in hours is a very solid plan that may result in a reliable and productive team. The explanation regarding the increasing of costs is well based and aligned with the outreach strategy. However, the argumentation to justify the decreased of the number of workshops would be more reliable if data based and with impact demonstrated.
f6_assessments.q2: I don’t think the proposers established direct KPIs to use in the monitoring and evaluation of the project success phase. The meaning of success is not clear once the team did not propose a goal in number of new members boarding. Besides that, the idea of “delivering everything according to the schedule” seems to be a little bit out of reality. I agree that all the metrics exposed on proposal are relevant, but in order to show more credibility, I strongly recommend establishing percentual goals to each metric, once they could not know previously the exact number of candidates to each session or workshop. The inclusion of a timeline with some milestones and an implementation plan in Gantt diagram format would have allowed the easy auditability of this proposal. Apparently, the team also makes no mention of the potential risks the team might face in the process. It would be very useful if the team have a previous recover plan to keep track of the timetable. I recommend making an effort of forecast challenges with a risk matrix of probability and impact. It should help to address bad risks before it happens or even to take advantage of an opportunity (e.g., an unexpected high attendance). In summary, we don’t have enough information about auditability that it could be done in an organized way.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal covers all the work to introduce new members into the different roles of catalyst in order to convert passive ADA holders into active Catalyst members; foster more meaningful engagement from challenge groups, proponents, mentors, mentors, and voters; encourage new members to calculate available tools and services to introduce; improves the use of existing text, video and audio documents so it's perfectly suited to the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal offers a roadmap of 8 sessions in fund 9 scheduled for 6 weeks, is expected to provide 30 one-to-one support sessions done in week 3. The requested budget is calculated at the price. $50 for 1 hour of work. The proposer has provided the contents that need to be done in order to calculate the working hours, so I feel that this cost is appropriate. The project team has 10 members who are all experienced people to fit the project in my experience. I recommend that they provide evidence related to their experience so that it is easy for newcomers to evaluate their experience.
f6_assessments.q2: The content of the time is clearly presented. The work content to be achieved to evaluate the KPI is posted on youtube, the website, However, it would be better if it could provide indicators of success with specific numbers.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes it does. I can strongly agree that there are  members who still struggle to understand how Catalyst works and how to play their roles and how they/individual can give there best so that it can help whole community to scale and grow. I Think its topmost requirement for individual to understand their role in this chain so that it can eventually help community to become very strong and easily scalable. Catalyst School will be helpful for Catalyst by improving the contribution of all its different players and roles and also for new member and proposer it will be really easy and helpful to understand whole process in order to successfully present or review ideas. Also live session workshop, interactive website all those ideas will be really impactful for individual or whole community. one can easily participate and learn and understand various level of roles and responsibilities via mentioned levels and strategy.
f6_assessments.q1: yes. The problem statement is very clear and so does the plan and experience. Also they have project lead, project manager to execute whole plan smoothly. The goal is very simple yet very useful for individual. also their workshops are  going to be synchronised with each phase of Project Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes they clearly mentioned each steps and process to audit the progress successfully. They also mentioned existing partners which will be helpful for successful execution of proposal and they have also identified that low attendant was their big challenge for last funding round and they are going to resolve it via marketing and other strategy so that will be beneficial.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal raises the problem that new and old Catalyst members (Proposers, Advisors, Voters) still find it difficult to learn about Catalyst, how it works. Catalyst School was established from Fund 6, is a place created to enhance the impact of Catalyst as a whole by improving the contribution of all its different players and roles. It has been introducing new members, helping the community, helping to improve their skills. The school has carried out activities such as: organizing live lessons and seminars, 1-to-1 and group support in many different languages, Interactive website, Other workshops related to Catalyst with topics about Catalyst such as: Introduction to Catalyst, Proposing in Catalyst, How to be a CA, vCA. As they describe, in the past time, they have held several sessions and introduced more than 1000 new Catalyst members, however, this number has not been verified. In addition, they also organize information sharing workshops, seminars in the Catalyst Eastern Town Hall, the WADA Conference 2021, Cardano 4 Climate and other events. The Catalyst School also has many partnerships such as: Gimbalabs, WADA, Eastern Town Hall, Tutorial for Community Advisors… With this proposal, they continue to carry out the work they have been doing to introduce new members to Catalyst with different roles. They will work on the issues of how to convert passive ADA holders into active Catalyst members, to foster more meaningful participation from challenger groups, proponents, advisors, advisors and voters, to encourage new members to use the tools and services available to join…
They also give the risk that during Fund 7, the number of participants was very low, and they have given the solution to increase marketing, improve outreach strategies to increase participation in their seminars and support sessions. But they do not give the results of the implemented solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
- They will provide 8 sessions in Fund 9, following the Project Catalyst schedule with a roadmap for 6 weeks from week 1 to week 6 with specific phases such as: Insight Sharing Phase, Proposal Submission Phase, Proposal Refinement Phase… Besides, they will provide 30 1-to-1/group support sessions in Fund 9. I think after learning experience in Fund 7, they will perform better in this Fund.
- Requested funds is 17,800 USD. The proposal has detailed budget for each job, each position such as: Project leader, project manager, secretary, document, conference organizer, marketing... These jobs are hourly with Unit price is 50 USD/hour. In my opinion, if they charged different unit prices for jobs of different nature, it would be more appropriate.
- The project implementation staff consists of many people (10 people) who are qualified and experienced in fields such as education, software engineers... most of them are CAs, vCAs, members of Catalyst... but there is no link for reference information.
f6_assessments.q2:
With the roadmap above, they will provide progress report to IOG in the bi-weekly coordinator meetings and to the challenge team in the monthly meeting. They also endorse the project by: uploading seminars to their Youtube Channel, all content will be available on their website, providing a list with contacts from all Community members who requested for 1-to-1 support sessions. Thus, the community can check the progress of the project.
They will also track some specific metrics such as: number of workshop participants (maximum and average), number of 1-to-1 support sessions provided, number of view on our YouTube videos, number of accesses in our website , number of sign-ups in our website.
This proposal is a continuation of three proposals already funded in previous Funds: The Catalyst School, the Catalyst School - Multilanguage, the Catalyst School - Website.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal addresses a key struggle often identified by new community members as they try to find a clear path into the catalyst community. 

Catalyst School aims to help onboard new members through improving their skills by offering courses on the variety of different roles that can be undertaken in the community. 

The intention is to onboard new members and support them as they become integrated into the community, enhancing the impact of Catalyst. 

By giving new members the skill and confidence needed to participate in the community they are more likely to fully onboard and become strong community members.
f6_assessments.q1:
As the Catalyst School is already an established body within Project Catalyst there is a proven track record to back up their proposal. 

The team is in place and have relevant experience not only outside this project but directly in implementing the goals of this proposal. 

The budget is well detailed and well understood with relevant changes and explanations given based on budgets from previous funding. 

The proposer has considered the risk of poor attendance to classes. 

As Project Catalyst grows, the need to support new members will also grow, making this proposal valuable now and moving forward.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear road map with clear KPIs allowing a measurable understanding of success based on things like class attendance, video views etc. 

The proposal is set out clearly, allowing catalyst members to not only to know the objectives but to understand them.

This gives the opportunity for the community to audit this project with ease.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement is congruent with the challenge.  Creating meaningful participation among the members of the community requires them to understand their roles and how to fulfill them.  Understanding requires education and training beyond mere documentation.  Not everyone learns in the same way.  The Catalyst School understands this and has different learning methods for the subjects that it covers.  They have been in operation since the beginning of Fund 6.  They are using the feedback they are receiving to improve their programs so as time goes on they are getting better at what they do.  They have onboarded more than 1000 new catalyst members, thus what they are doing is helping to achieve the goals of the challenge.  The partnerships they are involved with doing even more to expand their reach and enlarge the community.  However in describing how the proposed solution addresses the challenge they could have done more to show how specifically they are aligned with the guiding questions rather than just say they are aligned and list them.
It is good that they have awareness of the challenges they face and have owned up to their shortcomings in regards to the lack of attendance and therefore the need for additional outreach.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team members' experience is succinctly described and gives the impression that they have the necessary background, know-how, and knowledge to implement the proposal successfully.  However given that one of the biggest challenges and risks that they face is a lack of attendance they could have done better to include more expertise in marketing, outreach, and community organization.

The budget appears to be well defined and the individual components add up to the requested funds. They have done a good job in estimating the effort required and detailing the tasks involved.  The goals and deliverables are clearly shown so that it is easily understood what will be delivered and when.

The realization that they have made based on their previous experience to have fewer sessions and higher attendance is a good one.  However given that attendance is a challenge, they could have done more to detail the specifics of the marketing that will be done to increase it.  They do say those weekly announcements will be made on their social media, but they don’t really go into detail about what those announcements will be and the audiences that they will target.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal indicates that they will provide regular progress reports.  They indicate the metrics that will be used to measure success. However, what they are lacking are actual measurable goals to be achieved. Given the issues with attendance, and the data that they have from previous events, it would have been good to make some growth goals in percentage terms so they have something clear to work towards in regards to attendance.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is directly linked to onboard new members to project catalyst along the whole process of the project. The team already can provide impact, stating that 1,000+ participants have taken their courses or have been provided guidance in 1-to-1 sessions. The proposal addresses a broad scope of the objectives of the challenge, which is consistent with what services they provide to the catalyst community.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is already operating since fund 6 and has successfully provided service to 1000+ participants. The risk of outreach to possible participants has been outlined, also mitigation to this aspect. I recommend to look at further ways to expand Catalyst Schools footprint, e.g. by providing incentives of participation, possible badges to showcase certain extend of qualification (might be relevant to CA/vCA) etc. to impulse participation.
f6_assessments.q2: Since being an established project very tight to Catalyst process itself, having a detailed plan along the timeline of each funding round and direct visibility to the catalyst community, auditability of this proposal is ensured. Catalyst School has evolved as part of the community-driven back-bone of Catalyst Project, to underpin this specific status on KPIs and future targets can be relevant to work towards project expansion and improvement, giving the voter and community assurance of a successful development of Catalyst School.

solution: Catalyst School, a place to enhance the impact of Catalyst as a whole by improving the contribution of all its different players and roles.
experience: Veteran advisors and proposal mentors, education professionals, very active Catalyst community members since early Funds, already Catalyst School funded team, Catalyst Circle ex-members and more.
